001package org.apache.turbine.pipeline;
002

021
022import java.io.IOException;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.Iterator;
025import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
026
027import jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.XmlAccessType;
028import jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.XmlAccessorType;
029import jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.XmlAttribute;
030import jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.XmlElement;
031import jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.XmlElementWrapper;
032import jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.XmlRootElement;
033import jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlJavaTypeAdapter;
034
035import org.apache.turbine.annotation.AnnotationProcessor;
036import org.apache.turbine.util.TurbineException;
037
038/**
039 * Flexible implementation of a {@link org.apache.turbine.pipeline.Pipeline}.
040 * Originally based on code from Catalina and ideas from Apache httpd.
041 *
042 * @author <a href="mailto:dlr@finemaltcoding.com">Daniel Rall</a>
043 * @author <a href="mailto:jvanzyl@zenplex.com">Jason van Zyl</a>
044 * @author <a href="mailto:peter@courcoux.biz">Peter Courcoux</a>
045 */
046@XmlRootElement(name="pipeline")
047@XmlAccessorType(XmlAccessType.NONE)
048public class TurbinePipeline
049        implements Pipeline, ValveContext
050{
051    /**
052     * The "Turbine Classic" pipeline.
053     */
054    public static final String CLASSIC_PIPELINE =
055            "/WEB-INF/conf/turbine-classic-pipeline.xml";
056
057    /**
058     * Name of this pipeline.
059     */
060    @XmlAttribute
061    private String name;
062
063    /**
064     * The set of Valves associated with this Pipeline.
065     */
066    private CopyOnWriteArrayList<Valve> valves = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
067
068    /**
069     * The per-thread execution state for processing through this pipeline.
070     */
071    private ThreadLocal<Iterator<Valve>> state = new ThreadLocal<>();
072
073    /**
074     * @see org.apache.turbine.pipeline.Pipeline#initialize()
075     */
076    @Override
077    public void initialize()
078            throws Exception
079    {
080        // Valve implementations are added to this Pipeline using the
081        // Mapper.
082
083        // Initialize the valves
084        for (Valve v : valves)
085        {
086            AnnotationProcessor.process(v);
087            v.initialize();
088        }
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Set the name of this pipeline.
093     *
094     * @param name
095     *            Name of this pipeline.
096     */
097    public void setName(String name)
098    {
099        this.name = name;
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Get the name of this pipeline.
104     *
105     * @return String Name of this pipeline.
106     */
107    public String getName()
108    {
109        return name;
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * @see org.apache.turbine.pipeline.Pipeline#addValve(Valve)
114     */
115    @Override
116    public void addValve(Valve valve)
117    {
118        // Add this Valve to the end of the set associated with this Pipeline
119        valves.add(valve);
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * @see org.apache.turbine.pipeline.Pipeline#getValves()
124     */
125    @Override
126    @XmlElementWrapper(name="valves")
127    @XmlElement(name="valve")
128    @XmlJavaTypeAdapter(XmlValveAdapter.class)
129    public Valve[] getValves()
130    {
131        return valves.toArray(new Valve[0]);
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Set new valves during deserialization
136     *
137     * @param valves the valves to set
138     */
139    protected void setValves(Valve[] valves)
140    {
141        this.valves = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>(valves);
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * @see org.apache.turbine.pipeline.Pipeline#removeValve(Valve)
146     */
147    @Override
148    public void removeValve(Valve valve)
149    {
150        valves.remove(valve);
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * @see org.apache.turbine.pipeline.Pipeline#invoke(PipelineData)
155     */
156    @Override
157    public void invoke(PipelineData pipelineData)
158            throws TurbineException, IOException
159    {
160        // Initialize the per-thread state for this thread
161        state.set(Collections.unmodifiableCollection(valves).iterator());
162
163        // Invoke the first Valve in this pipeline for this request
164        invokeNext(pipelineData);
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * @see org.apache.turbine.pipeline.ValveContext#invokeNext(PipelineData)
169     */
170    @Override
171    public void invokeNext(PipelineData pipelineData)
172            throws TurbineException, IOException
173    {
174        // Identify the current valve for the current request thread
175        Iterator<Valve> current = state.get();
176
177        if (current.hasNext())
178        {
179            // Invoke the requested Valve for the current request
180            // thread and increment its thread-local state.
181            current.next().invoke(pipelineData, this);
182        }
183    }
184}
